comments:
this is found in EPF 1.0.1

steps to reproduce,

1. do a config export of a config with one plugin (config1 and plugin1)
2. delete config1 and plugin1 in Lib
3. create a new config, called config1
4. use the previously exported file for a config import,
5. got prompt errors and in .log

!STACK 0
org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MultiFileIOException: Resource is out of synch and needs to be reloaded: C:\Documents and Settings\longli.RATIONAL\Method Libraries\test5\library.xmi
	at org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MultiFileSaveUtil.checkOutOfSynch(MultiFileSaveUtil.java:497)
	at org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MethodLibraryPersister$FailSafePersister.adjustLocation(MethodLibraryPersister.java:698)
	at org.eclipse.epf.authoring.ui.views.LibraryView$13.run(LibraryView.java:1873)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.edit.ui.UserInteractionHelper$6.run(UserInteractionHelper.java:507)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

Fixed in "MultiFileResourceSetImpl" by calling "updateTimeStamps" in "save(Map options, boolean saveAll)". Also added a resource "refreshLocal" call in FileManager.move method to make sure a timely refreshing resource.

Fix checked into epf 1.0.2.
Fix is verified on build EPF 1.0.2 20070108.
